answers.answer: I have PCOS and don't receive treatment for it yet, but I have heard that metformin does help with ovulation and weightloss. Tell your doctor that you wish to conceive and he'll know what's better for you.  Good luck with everything!

question: Hello all,I am just writing to get aquainted with PCOS.  I have a Prolactin Producing Pituitary Tumor, Hashimotos Thyroid, Type 2 diabetes, Depression, High Blood Pressure, and now apparently PCOS... My dr. has been testing for Cushing's but has decided PCOS to be more probable.I have always dealt with endometriosis and cysts.  I was on birth control for 2 years and my symptoms decreased, but I gained a lot of weight.  (40 lbs)Since beginning treatment for the tumor and thyroid condition I had ceased the medication I was on for Diabetes and just been controlling it with diet and exercise.  (I was started on Metformin and switched to Janumet).  My dr. has suggested I go back on Metformin for weight loss, regulate my periods and help with unwanted hair growth that has begun.Any suggestions, tips or other would be appreciated.PS. I have a 7 year old son from my first marriage. I am 30 and my husband and I started trying for a baby about 6 months ago.
title: recent diagnosis with PCOS
